text: this is where the storm first hit land
it's an isolated village called TyTy
right on the coast and as you can see
the devastation here is complete and
spectacular no houses standing a lot of
people killed washed out to sea when the
floods came running over the land here
most of the damage though done by the
wind there is literally nothing left
standing here what's interesting is that
although this was the first to be hit it
seems to be one of the last areas in the
Philippines to get really any
significant aid this place has been cut
off for many days because of the storm
damage there is though a big runway just
up the road there and that finally is
open and we started today to see the
very first big cargo flights coming in
to bring aid a little bit further beyond
that is the town of gear on and that is
also completely leveled and there had
been really serious problems with
looting and desperation as people waited
for the outside world to get to them and
to bring help what I can say now is that
that town is much calmer the local
authorities do seem to be in control and
while people are pretty desperate
supplies are getting in people are
queuing in a much more orderly fashion
now for things and generally there is a
sense of some law and order in town
